concepts.title: Structure of a Root
concepts.content: The part of the plant that grows from the seed into the soil is the root. The radical grows into the root. Roots have root hairs to absorb water and a root cap to protect the tip as it pushes through the soil.
keyPoints: Roots provide support and absorb water/minerals
The root cap protects the delicate growing tip
Roots like carrot and radish also store food
concepts.funFact: Banyan trees have 'prop roots' that grow from branches into the ground to support their massive weight!
